Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, we will defintely come back”
Reviews.Author: cadutauil
Reviews.Content: Very clean, service at the front desk was excellent. The staff spoke english well as again were very helpful. Rooms were clean, tidy and the AC worked well. The rooms were very affordable and had great value.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good - Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: JadSawaya
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul with my wife for our first wedding anniversary in December 2010. We arrived around 2pm to the hotel and waited in the lobby approximately 3 hours for a room (while waiting we weren't offered drinks or any kind of attention). The room that was being prepared for us is on the 7th floor. While waiting we were the ones who had to follow up with the reception! Not to mention that 2 girls arrived after us and sat next to us waiting for a room as well. They were young russians. They came after us and took a room before us. One of the girls went to the receptionist (short guy with well combed hair) and they started smiling and talking until she came back with a key calling her friend to join her. After that scene, we went again to argue with the receptionist, he made us wait an additional half an hour and then gave us a corner room on the 11th floor inistead of the one on the 7th floor stating that it was one of the best rooms in the hotel (Corner rooms are half size normal rooms - we know that because we saw our friends room which we met in Istanbul by surprise). My guess the room on the 7th which was supposed to be ours was given to the russians instead. That said, the receptionist was not only a liar but rude as well. Added to all the above, we booked a 5 night stay with Marmara Taksim Hotel INCLUDING breakfast via expedia. Despite that statement clear on the vouchers, the receptionist and the manager (via phone call) insisted that breakfast was not to be offered because it wasn't showing in their system. We argued again for nothing, again waste of time and manners. We ended up paying breakfast 2 times!! (20 Euros per person = 200 Euros for the whole trip). The Marmara Taksim Hotel was lucky because the package that i booked via expedia was non-refundable or else i would have simply left the hotel and booked another one. As for breakfast (which is a bit poor), we are supposed to be present before 10am (or 11am, pardon me for not remembering), but when that hour comes, they remove all the food on the buffet!! even while people are still having breakfast. We travel a lot and seeing that shocked us. We never saw that one coming. They are supposed to not let anyone come in the restaurant for breakfast and not remove the food!! were they saving food for the next day? Well no idea. Only good thing about the hotel is the location..

Reviews.Title: “Keep far away”
Reviews.Author: marky1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good location but what a waste of money. I stayed there from 25 to 28 October. Its advertised as a 4 star, nonsense.It doesnt qualify as a 2 star hotel. No tea/coffee facilities.Be warned, they dont accept debit cards.The room are dirty, the furniture is so old and damaged.Its like a very bad joke, thats how that place is. So dont waste your hard earned money in this place. Try other places.In the end, i went to Moss suites.Fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BerkoBoy88
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. We requested a quiet room at the back overlooking the Bosphorus because we were told it was too noisy at the front overlooking the Square. Good job we did, it was very noisy at the front! The room was clean, tidy and large. The breakfast was only adequate. However, by British standards this is definitely NOT a 4* hotel. We are experienced travellers and we can assure you that this is only a 3* hotel, our reasons are many, but those which are important to UK travellers are that there were no coffee/tea making facilities in the room, no plugs in the hand wash basin OR bath, making it impossible for anyone wishing to have a bath and not a shower. Also the Internet facility broke down for several days, as did the television satellite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: GoldskyEgypt
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel with perfect location. Rooms are quiet reasonable and clean. Bathroom is nice and clean but small. Breakfast is good. The best of the Hotel is the Staff, Atilgan in Front Office was very good and rest of the staff are helpful and polite persons. It is very important point in Hotels. They made our stay comfortable and pleasant. Thanks for the management.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: pcc10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable,we had a room with a view of the water. Front desk people were friendly and helpful. Do not book a room with a view of the Square some of the people traveling with us had those rooms and they were awake all night with the noise outside

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location-average service”
Reviews.Author: Bosporos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Taksim Square hotel for 3 nights; we chose the hotel because of its location, just over Taksim Square. The hotel is not something special and it needs rennovation; actually one of the guys working in the reception told us that some floors are under rennovation so after that i guess it will be even more worthy to stay there. Yes, the location is just perfect; you go out and you have in front of you Istiklal Str. Any time of the day and night you need to buy something it's just outside the entrance; our room was on the 6th floor looking at the Bosphorous which was also very nice view. BUT; the room's furniture was very old. We wanted double bed and they gave us 2 single beds that we had to unite. The furniture were corrupted and they absolutely need change. The good thing was the television that had many international and local channels and the perfect wireless Internet connection. The room was not very clean; the previous customer had forgotten its Burger King papers bags and they were there, and when we moved the 2 single beds to unite them, there were some smashed biscuits under the beds; also the view was perfect but the window was not cleaned for long time and you couldn't enjoy the view. Other than that our room was very silent, which is a rare thing for that neighbourhood; i guess a room overlooking the main road would be very noisy. The breakfast was not satisfying at all; we just ate the first day and we didn't eat again because we didn't like the quality. We gave 80 euro per night which is a logical price for an average hotel in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “A four-star hotel not worthy of its rating”
Reviews.Author: drdemento
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is conveniently located on Taksim Square, close to good shopping on Istiqlal Street and to restaurants and public transportation. And, yes, there is a restaurant on the top floor which serves a luxurious breakfast every morning. But the bathroom in our room had a funky outhouse odor, as if the exhaust fan was inadequate to draw out bathroom smells, and the furnishings in the public areas and in the rooms had a decidedly rundown look. The hotel urgently needs a major overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ozan95
Reviews.Content: This hotel is too old and requires major repair. The bed in the room where i stayed was broken and was making noise every time. The hotel was not dirty, but also not very clean. Personnel was ok, breakfast very limited. I would not recommend this hotle for those who go to Istanbul for holidays. If you have no other choice, then you may choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy & Going Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: curly39
Reviews.Content: I don't know what all those other reviews are complaining about, but I thought the Taksim Square Hotel was very nice. Here are some pros and cons: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ PROS -I was a single female traveller and felt very safe. -Recieved respect & help whenever needed. -They took my messages for me -Wireless Internet is available -I was quite satisfied with the service (cleaning& Reception) -VERY Satisfied with restaurant downstairs. -Many receptionists who were all very helpful. -Excellent location. -Very clean, the floors were sparkling. -The room was very clean as well. -Very nice view from either end of hotel. CONS: -Room was a little dark. (They need to add more lighting.) -Rooftop restaurant is only open during certain hours. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- I've travelled in many cities, stayed in hostels from $10/nt to hotels of $250/nt. I stayed in Taksim Square for 2 weeks and was very pleased. The price was very affordable. I will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool reception and an overall disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Gaius_Tacitus
Reviews.Content: Not much endears this hotel 'except' is location. It is right on Taksim Square and only seconds from the night life of Istanbul. I arrived to a cool reception and that was about all the service that was supplied over the four days that I stayed there. Previously I had stayed at the great Dersaadet Hotel on the southern side of the Golden Horn and the difference between the two hotels could not have been greater. Being right on Taksim Square is certainly advantageous and the views, if you are on the upper floors, are good. However, on my return from a tour about ten days later I had a room on the opposite side to my original room, down low, and I had a spectacular view of the Air Conditioning plant (as AC plants go, I've seen better). The Taksim Square was clean and tidy I admit but it was also rather noisy as well. I was awoken quite often by noise coming up from the Square in the early hours. Overall, I wouldn't stay there again, especially when there is the Dersaadet on the other side of town. It is a 'Tourist Hotel' and that's all one should expect.

Reviews.Title: “let down”
Reviews.Author: P_Coakes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had planned to splurge a little for our last night in Istanbul...wish we had heard of tripadvisor before! The location was great however as the other reviews state, the service was way below par. We had experienced great hospitality throughout Turkey but even asking for a clean pillow case was too much to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Frosty reception”
Reviews.Author: 2_4_Turkey
Reviews.Content: Having booked a double room at the hotel we arrived at night to find that we were put into a twin room. We said we would not accept that and were told at the reception desk our room would be changed in the morning. However, the next morning, with a change of staff, we were told we could not change rooms as the hotel was fully booked. Strangely enough we overheard a Turkish man complaining about his room booking and he wanted to change two rooms, which they seemed to take care of. When we asked yet again to have ours changed, they shrugged their shoulders and said there was nothing they could do. We had asked to see the manager twice, but apparently he was always out on the street somewhere. At that point I said we would check out and wanted a refund. They took no notice. I believe they thought we were bluffing. Still at the reception desk I phoned the Turkish agency that made the booking - a very helpful company. They heard me talking to the agent and, hey presto, seconds into my phone conversation they came up with a double room. The next fiasco was over an extra pillow. I phoned twice to housekeeping, but they never answered the phone. We asked twice at the front desk and were assured that a pillow would be delivered to our room. It never appeared. When we came in at the end of the night and asked the night reception staff for a pillow, the man shouted and hurled abuse saying that we should have asked for one earlier. Talk about the right hand not knowing what the left hand is doing! We were then told there were no spare pillows as the hotel was full. What a load of nonsense! Yet another miracle - a pillow was found and reluctantly brought to our room, but not without a screaming match to get one. The last night we were there we bought a bottle of water and a bottle of coke to take back to our room. We were stopped by the same rude night desk staff member and told we could not bring them into the hotel. I have never heard of any such thing, regardless of how much any hotel might want to sell their minibar drinks. He was adamant and said that if we did not leave them in the reception he would call the police! We thought he was off his head. We did take the drinks back to our room and no police arrived. We went to see the manager about the situation the next day but he was still absent (or so they said). We have travelled around the world and stayed in 2* hotels up to 5* hotels, mainly the latter. We have never been treated so appallingly by anyone or any hotel in the world. A word of warning - If any of you decide you will stay at this hotel, make sure you have a room at the back of the hotel, overlooking the Bosphoros. The front overlooks the main square and is incredibly noisy - the call to prayer from the mosque across the street and the constant loudspeakers of the police right through the night could drive you crackers. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone. There are far better ones on the side streets in Taksim.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: I_Love_Istanbul
Reviews.Content: The lobby and rooms are a four-star level in my opinion, especially compared with many other hotels I have seen in various parts of Turkey. But the service was terrible! Although we were paying $200 per night for our room, there is a sign in the lobby prohibiting guests from taking any food or drink to their rooms---even water. You are expected to buy the very expensive water from the minibar, which is $4 a bottle; water at the markets on the street cost 30 cents. Some other guests told us they even had staff at the hotel confiscate the water and pieces of chocolate they were bringing to their rooms---although they were told they would be returned to them as they were leaving! We had another problem when we forgot to remove our Do Not Disturb sign from our door as we left one day, and the room was not made up. When we called down and asked if we could at least get some clean towels, we were told that it was impossible, as housekeeping closed at 5 p.m., and they didn't have a key! The attitude and approach of the staff was extremely disappointing because most of the Turkish people I have met are warm, friendly, and helpful beyond expectation. If you want a comfortable room in a good location, this is a good choice, but don't expect good service.

Reviews.Title: “big mistake”
Reviews.Author: matakan
Reviews.Content: its not 4 star hotel in my mind its 1 star hotel. Hotel looks like a shop which is bunkrupt and emtying itself by selling everything half price. Rooms confort is level of 1 star hotel. Find another hotel around taksim square, that hotel ll be ur the worsest selection in this location......

Reviews.Title: “It's a 2 star hotel not 4”
Reviews.Author: vdede
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous review. I would not rate this hotel 4 star. maybe 2. Location is great. Always request Boshorus view. Taksim side could be noisy. Breakfast was good and view was great. Even though my room was non smoking still smelled like someone smoked in the room. Rooms looks warned out and very dark. Beds are small and bathroom shower door was broken. Be carefull changing money at Taksim square. Always use the bank. If in desperation check the money you receive from the change location. I ended up with fake 20 Turkish lira. It's hard to tell the conterfeit money. Watch out for pick pockets. Would I stay at this hotel again? If I was on budget YES. I will check other properties next time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location for Taksim Square”
Reviews.Author: tausif
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. This is truly 4 star standard. The breakfast room also has a good view which has recently been refurbished. The staff were courteous and very professional. It has, in our opinion, the best location for Taksim square with many fast food , coffee houses and shops near by. Unfortunately, the hotel's website has no secure server for booking, therefore we used a mail order form which they forwarded to us. We did not want to send our credit card details by email ! We would not hesitate to stay here again if we needed to stay near Taskim square, but next time we will stay in the Sultanhamet area, the other side of the Great Horn to explore this area which seemed a little more chic. As an aside, if you're not familiar with this locale, you should be aware that almost everybody smokes and most restaurants have no non-smoking areas. Also in the Taksim squ area it seemed that fewer people understood English, compared to those we came across in the Sultahamet area. Overall as a hotel, this is a very good one and a public transport hub is at hand near by almost on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: olipom
Reviews.Content: Spot on location! Right on taxim square, near the shops and restaurants of modern Istanbul. The ancient tramline is no longer working - or maybe it was closed whilst the street was being repaved - but it's a pleasant walk down to the tunel funicular, which then links to the city tram services. A taxi to the train station should cost around 10ytl. The hotel is very comfortable, rooms are large. Our room was at the back of the hotel so had no problems with noise from the road. The a/c is great after a hot day in town. Breakfast in the top-floor restaurant is fantastic, and a great view, when we were there the waiters were feeding seagulls out of the windows, looking out on to the golden horn. Fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: KaGu
Reviews.Content: First: If you're going to stay in the Taksim area, it will be hard to beat this hotel's location - smack on Taksim square, with all the shops of Istical Cadessi stretching from the square itself . A few steps away are the veteran tram (going down to the Galata tower area), the buses taking you to the Sulthanamet mosques area, the Metro, and the Airport Shuttle bus.(TRL 8,- about USD 7,- ) The hotel itself is very well kept, seemingly newly renovated. I found its interior pleasing, modern and clean.Breakfast was included in my rate (USD 95,- booked on the net through "TR hotels"), and was served on the 9th floor with a magnificient view over the "Golden Horn" with ships passing at all times. My room was a comfortable double, facing the Taksim Square.Some noise from the traffic , but then again the traffic is pretty noisy all over Istanbul. Bathroom was modern and clean with a tub\shower and nice fluffy towels. The windows can only be tilted half way up.The air condition worked perfectly. The TV had mostly Turkish channels, but also provided CNN US and BBC World, in addition to some German and French channels. Upon my arrival I had a problem with the in-room safe, which the staff fixed promptly. All staff members I encountered were english speaking,at least well enough to communicate without problems. Adjoining the hotel is the "Taksim Square Cafe" which was great for lunch or an evening meal.Very good pasta! I have to say I really liked The Taksim Square Hotel, and would be happy to stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Taksim Square Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Siraselviler Cad No 15 | Taksim, Istanbul 34340, Turkey
